attractions.title: Antalya
attractions.description: 2.400 bin civarında Antalya Nüfusu ile Türkiye’nin dünyaca ünlü turizm şehridir. Başlı başına bir turizm cenneti Antalya; dünyanın en iyi otellerini içinde barındırmaktadır. Başta Alanya, Side, Belek, Kaş, Kalkan, Kemer, Manavgat ilçeleri ile birlikte Antalya dünyanın en çok talep edilen Tatil kentlerinin başında gelmektedir. Antalya Doğal güzellikleri,Tarihi mekanları ve Antalya gezilecek yerlerini birde muhteşem Antalya Otelleri ve Antalya Tatil köyleri ile birleştirince adeta Dünya genelinde Turizm başkentlerinden biri olmuştur.
facts: Largest town on the island of Dugi Otok, though it is small enough for everyone to know each other.
It is a fishing village that hosts a traditional “festa” or festival every year to honor fishermen traditions, drawing in tourists from all over Europe.
The Dalmatian breed of dogs is from the same region of Croatia, known as “Dalmatia.”
Borders two beautiful national parks, Telascica and Kornati.

attractions.title: Muğla
attractions.description:
Tarihte birçok hükümdarın iştahını kabarttığı, ele geçirmek için can attığı Bodrum, şimdilerde birçok kişinin yaz deyince aklına gelen ilk yerlerden. Peki, Bodrum nasıl Bodrum olmuş bugünlere nasıl gelmiş bir bakalım.

Eski adı Halikarnas olan Bodrum Dor’lar tarafından kurulmuş. Onlardan sonra Karyalılar ve İyon halkına ev sahipliği yapmış. Halikarnas deniziyle doğasıyla bulunduğu konum itibariyle devletlerin, İmparatorların dikkatini çekmeye başlamış ve bu yüzden işgallerle karşılaşmış. Perslerden Büyük İskender’e, Mısır Kralı’ndan Romalılara, Bizans İmparatorluğu’ndan Osmanlı’ya kadar bütün medeniyetleri içinde barındırmış. En sonunda da Cumhuriyet döneminde Bodrum adını almış.

Sadece medeniyetlere değil önemli kişilere de ev sahipliği yapmış Bodrum; tarihin babası Herodot burada doğmuş. Ama Herodot siyasi düşünceleri yüzünden Lygdamis tarafından Halikarnas’tan sürülmüş ve Samos Adasına yerleşmiş. Bu sürgün onun kitap yazmasını sağlayacak seyahatlerin de başlangıcı olmuş. Mısır, Mezopotamya, Filistin, Rusya ve Afrika’ya giderek gördüğü yerleri ve insanları anlattığı ‘’Herodot Tarihi ‘’ni yazarak tarihin babası olma yolunda ilk adımını atmıştır.
facts: The capital of Croatia
The Zagreb Cathedral is the tallest building in Croatia.

The upper town of Zagreb has over 200, non-electric lamp posts that are hand lit every evening and extinguished every morning. The same man has held this role for many years, though now being in his 70s, has an apprentice to help him.
Has the world’s shortest public transport vehicle, the Zagreb Funicular, which takes only 60 seconds to take you between parts of the city.

attractions.title: Zadar
attractions.description: Zadar, a city on Croatia’s Dalmatian coast, is known for the Roman and Venetian ruins of its peninsular Old Town. There are several Venetian gates in the city walls. Surrounding the Roman-era Forum is 11th-century St. Mary’s Convent, with religious art dating to the 8th century. There’s also the grand, 12th-century St. Anastasia’s Cathedral and the round, 9th-century pre-Romanesque Church of St. Donatus.
facts: There are many ancient ruins in this city, including a fortress wall that borders some of the city.
Zadar is the site of the sea organs, which appear like regular steps into the sea, but sound like beautiful organ music due to the crashing of the waves against them.
It is known to have the best sunset in the world

attractions.title: Plitvice Lakes National Park
attractions.description: Plitviče Lakes National Park is a 295-sq.-km forest reserve in central Croatia. It's known for a chain of 16 terraced lakes, joined by waterfalls, that extend into a limestone canyon. Walkways and hiking trails wind around and across the water, and an electric boat links the 12 upper and 4 lower lakes. The latter are the site of Veliki Slap, a 78m-high waterfall.
facts: There are 16 lakes and 90 waterfalls
You can walk and hike around the waterfalls, even being able to dip your hands in at some points.
The color of the lakes are never the same- ranging daily from shades of emerald green, deep blue, and faded gray.

The caves of Plitvice Lakes are home to unique and rarely seen creatures that have existed since ancient times. There is even legend that a wise monk inhabits one of the caves and will give you sage advice if you seek it.

attractions.title: Kornati National Park
attractions.description: Kornat is an island in the Croatian part of the Adriatic Sea, in central Dalmatia. With an area of 32.44 km² it is the 16th largest island in Croatia and the largest island in the eponymous Kornati islands archipelago.
facts: They are named for their triangular shaped islands and dry barren landscape
Donkeys and rams can frequently be seen on the islands
One of the kornati islands contains ancient ruins that are in fact, not authentic but rather, were created for a film and left behind.
You can go sailing through the kornati islands, though be careful of narrow straits that can only accommodate small boats!

attractions.title: Dubrovnik
attractions.description: Dubrovnik is a city in southern Croatia fronting the Adriatic Sea. It's known for its distinctive Old Town, encircled with massive stone walls completed in the 16th century. Its well-preserved buildings range from baroque St. Blaise Church to Renaissance Sponza Palace and Gothic Rector’s Palace, now a history museum. Paved with limestone, the pedestrianized Stradun (or Placa) is lined with shops and restaurants.
facts: Filming site of the hit series, Game of Thrones
The city is surrounded by ancient walls and fortifications.
It is only 3 meters above sea level.

attractions.title: Split
attractions.description: Split is Croatia's second-largest city and the largest city in the Dalmatia region. It lies on the eastern shore of the Adriatic Sea and is spread over a central peninsula and its surroundings.
facts: It is the largest city on the Dalmatian Coast
It is home to Diocletian’s Palace.
